title: A taste of Thailand
text:
Home » travel » A taste of Thailand Around Thailand The Nation   
Thai AirAsia has launched a 'Tasty Thailand' promotion through September. 
Na Dun district in Maha Sarakham Province is gearing up to host the Harmony Youth Rod Puppet Festival on September 18. 
Thai Airways International aims to connect with fans through social and digital media with the launch of its new website Social.ThaiAirways.com 
The annual Phuket Vegetarian Festival takes place from September 24 to October 2 A taste of Thailand Thai AirAsia has launched a "Tasty Thailand" promotion that allows passengers who show their AirAsia boarding pass to receive up to 10-per-cent off the bills or special menu items at more than 180 participating restaurants in Chiang Mai , Chiang Rai, Nan, Phitsanulok, Krabi, Phuket, Songkhla, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang and Khon Kaen. The "Tasty Thailand with AirAsia" promotion runs through December 31. Find out more at www.AirsAsia.com. Puppets on a string Na Dun district in Maha Sarakham Province is gearing up to host the Harmony Youth Rod Puppet Festival on September 18. Taking place at Na Dun Pagoda, one of the most revered stupas in the Northeast, the festival will feature a range of different puppet shows all orchestrated by young people. Nok Air and Thai AirAsia operate flights between Bangkok and Roi Et province, which is about 60 kilometres from Na Dun district. Getting social with Thai Thai Airways International aims to connect with fans through social and digital media with the launch of its new website Social.ThaiAirways.com. Published in Thai and English, the new website features travel and lifestyle content as well as user-based travel information. Check it out for fine restaurants and upcoming events at the airline's destinations, both locally and beyond the horizon. Visit Social.ThaiAirways.com. Living by the sword Take a trip to Phuket and make peace with your fellow creatures. The Southern province will again fly the yellow flags of the annual Phuket Vegetarian Festival from September 24 to October 2. One legend has it that the annual festival was inaugurated two centuries ago when a travelling Chinese Opera troupe successfully warded off a mysterious plague through a period of ritual vegetarianism. Whatever its beginnings, visitors these days can expect eye-popping displays of face and body piercing - not for the squeamish! Visit www.PhuketVegetarian.com. 149 Viewed
